formattedAddress: 1792 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10031, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1792 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10031, USA

originalText.text: I received gift cards from my dad to go here so wasn‚Äôt getting my hopes up, even tho the menu looked right up my ally. When we walked in it was practically no one but us - which isn‚Äôt necessarily a bad sign, and I was glad to have ‚Äúprivate dining‚Äù. The waitstaff was super nice and attended to us quickly. Lots of wine (no hard liquor) was available and beers on tap. We ordered the carpaccio, bread and butter wine, bread for the table, mushroom pasta, and the seafood pasta. The pasta is homemade which really makes the difference. Everything was piping hot and had so much flavor (I do not say this lightly as an Italian woman who loves spice). If you‚Äôre in the area, def stop in-it‚Äôs worth it !

originalText.text:
New rising star in Harlem. Beautiful decor, sleek but cozy, beautiful bar, spacious and welcoming. Although they are still waiting to get the gas installed to expand the menu, what we ate was delicious. In another week they expect to be fully running. Mini cachapas with cheese and Pabellon Criollo were beyond my expectations. It was happy hour so there was a menu of selected wines and beer at a very decent price. Don't expect big portions, this is a tapas bar. Tapas inspired in traditional Venezuelan cuisine. It will certainly become one of our sure values in the neighborhood.

We returned a year later to celebrate a special birthday. We made a reservation for 20 guests. We had picked in advance the wine and the food we would be serving. The service was beyond excellent! The food was delicious, everybody loved it. We had a beautiful happy evening. Thank you Barepas!

originalText.text:
My fianc√©e and I live in the neighborhood, and Casa d'la Pasta may be the best restaurant in Hamilton Heights. We have gone twice a week since they opened and have enjoyed every meal. And a growing number of our neighbors are discovering it as well.

Chef Crispin Mejia, co-owner of the well-regarded Crispin's Hells Kitchen, has created a menu for Casa d'la Pasta of delicious and authentic Italian cuisine, with fresh pastas made on site, delicious antipasti and creative main dishes. My favorites: the Bruschetta ai Fungi (mushrooms in white truffle oil on tuscan bread), Cavatelli alla Salsiccia (amazing homemade pasta with tomato and sausage), and a rich and fluffy Tiramisu. Owner Yancy Perez has developed an amazing wine list and established an ambiance that is friendly, warm and elegant.

Perhaps most important, Crispin, Yancy and the whole staff are the most welcoming people you'll meet. Casa d'la Pasta has become our go-to neighborhood restaurant for its delicious food, friendly service and cozy atmosphere.  It may very well be one of the best Italian restaurants in NYC.

Owner Yancy Perez has developed an amazing wine list and established an ambiance that is friendly, warm and elegant.

originalText.text:
We were here yesterday , for my birthday. My sister and I  have been waiting to visit this place, it's in the neighborhood. It definitely did not disappoint. Will definitely revist.

Pros:
-The person working was really nice. I say person cause he seemed like the owner, bartender, server.  He was everything. üòä
- food  was good.  It is made when ordered. It is also gluten free and fresh products
- I normally hate outside eating, one reason the tables and chairs usually are bad and wobbly.  But they are using the inside tables and they were great. My 2 year old couldn't knock it over.
- this is not a place for kids from what I see. But they had a kids cup. Not sure if it was off to the side or they offer kids cups. But he accommodated us. If I really wanted to get him something other than water, There are two corner stores/ bodegas/Deli right on the corner

In between:
-The prices are decent, you get a lot of food. When we ordered the person warned us it was a lot of food. But I said bring it on anyway.
- the burger looked small but it was thick.
- the Arepas look small but you can get full off of one.

Cons:
- we ordered margaritas and 1 sangria.  The margaritas were made poorly. Ice and tequila on the bottom and then the slush part on top.  It seemed like the margarita machine was running really low. So I assume he tried to make enough for 2. Which in this pandemic I understand . But he should have put slush on bottom and topped the tequila  to make it easier  to mix.  The sangria tasted like a wine spritzer with an orange in it, cause there was only an orange slice In it. Sangria would have been better if it at least had more fruits. Yet, it seems like he wasnt much of a bartender. He was the only one working besides the cook.
- even the food was AWESOME it was a bit on the salty side.

SN: MENU IS NOT ON THE WEBSITE, CHECK THEIR INSTAGRAM @barepasnyc

originalText.text:
This is an italian eatery. We selected this location because of the proximity to Washington Heights and the hours of operation on a weekday.
The server was extremely attentive. The decor is beautiful with some collections on both sides of the wall. I find their wine collection a bit limiting but nonetheless the wine was tasty at an affordable rate.
The bread was served with this yellow paste, which didn‚Äôt taste good. We requested some olive oil to dip our breads in for much richer taste and experience.

The food was delicious. I apologize, I did not take photos of the food but it was beautiful presented.
The ambiance is great but often times the kitchen light and  music are piercing through and you have two genres of music playing simultaneously which is rather off putting. Recommend tinting the doors of the kitchen so that bright light doesn‚Äôt affect the restaurant ambiance.

Bathroom is rather interesting with barn-like styled doors. Clean and spacious.

I would like to return to try their other dishes and wine selections. I recommend visiting this establishment if you‚Äôre in the mood for good food and wine.
